body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

body:
@Tiltowait I know you are one of the good faith users here. We may have disagreed on a few issues, but I respect the effort you put in to your content.

The OPT-IN vs OPT-OUT is the biggest issue to me. If the admins changed their stance on this, so all guilds we selected by default and the individual users opted to have their feeds censored, I would back them 100%. There is always a balance.

As it is they have refused to address this OPT-IN/OPT OUT and have kicked my post from +Ruqqus.

Please join us - you can always change your mind later.

body:
Sure. After all, I do kind of disagree with the "Offensive" category because of how subjective it is. Others have suggested renaming it or removing it entirely, and I myself don't really know what would work best. My preferred solution to the "opt in / opt out" problem is to have one listing where certain categories are opt-in and another one that's completely unaffected by the categorization system. The one that shows all guilds would be /all, and the one where some categories are opt-in would be the home page for logged-out users and a new one ("Custom"?) for logged-in users. While the default view would still hide some categories (to prevent new users from being driven away by the amount of political posts on the site), at least the name of the All listing wouldn't be deceptive anymore.

I'm not changing +RuqqusBugs because I'm not the only GM there, but I'll change all my other guilds that no one uses. +AnotherGuild, +GuildSquatting, +Introductions, +OtherChanges, +Private, +SomeGuild

I don't care if I get hit by the new ToS lol. I'll just change them back to "Offensive", and if I get banned, too bad for me. That would just be like earning a new badge for me. It's an achievement.

By the way, you can only tag 3 users per comment.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

post.title: Calling on all GMs in PROTEST of admin censorship - Ruqqus 2.29.3 "category improvements"

body:
Let me be clear about a few things

1. Categories IMHO are a "fix" to a problem that does not exist. In no way do I believe that any category should be applied to ALL or ALL sorted by NEW. We have already seen categories that are not weighted equally that prevent posts from being shown at all. There is no point to add additional filtering here when we as users can already do so with blocks. Remove the feature from this please.

2. If categories are to be used then only apply to home (maybe?) Or rework the guild search so that you can search guilds by the category chosen to find related guilds. This is now on each GM to categorize correctly if they want to be found in a search.

3. If something is to be deemed offensive then let us as users handle it. If we don't like it we should not have to view it. Admins can still deal with any ToS or unlawful violations.

4. For the home page, when not signed in, only show any admin moderated guilds such as +AskRuqqus or +Ruqqus. If a user is interested they can create an account.

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

parent.body:
Let me be clear about a few things

1. Categories IMHO are a "fix" to a problem that does not exist. In no way do I believe that any category should be applied to ALL or ALL sorted by NEW. We have already seen categories that are not weighted equally that prevent posts from being shown at all. There is no point to add additional filtering here when we as users can already do so with blocks. Remove the feature from this please.

2. If categories are to be used then only apply to home (maybe?) Or rework the guild search so that you can search guilds by the category chosen to find related guilds. This is now on each GM to categorize correctly if they want to be found in a search.

3. If something is to be deemed offensive then let us as users handle it. If we don't like it we should not have to view it. Admins can still deal with any ToS or unlawful violations.

4. For the home page, when not signed in, only show any admin moderated guilds such as +AskRuqqus or +Ruqqus. If a user is interested they can create an account.

**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

body:
Sweet, I made it onto another list in life. In fact I am more than one person on that list.

That said, I don't fully agree with the premise; I have created 200+ guilds in my time here, all of them except one being apolitical, and the vast majority of them are still semi-active (1+ post/month)...including pretty much every food guild except +Donuts. 

I do everything I can to drown out the hate; I don't cooperate with RCP but I have....more usernames on here than I can possibly ever remember. When Klenny got banned (and I do hate him as well, whiny little retard) I pointed out to him that I possibly ran more guilds across my sockpuppets than he did but admins never banned me...why? Realistically probably just because I'm a "force for good" in the world, and he's a "force for whiny stormfag bullshit". Is it fair? Probably not. Do I support the distinction? Probably not. Is it worth tearing down the site? Not really.

I hate the Milkit/Stormfag/JG nonsense on the site, and I think it should be as easy as possible for users to choose to block it all with one click...but the important word there is "choose to";  **I don't think it should be opt-in or opt-out, I think when you register your account it should just ask you which you prefer. **

I also think mods should go through the "Uncategorized" guilds and put the ones that GMs have never categorized into what appears to be common-sense categories ( +Cheese is probably food, +elephants is probably animals) - and I dislike their laziness on this matter. If you're going to roll out something like categories, you need to expect lots of manual work.

I strongly disagree with "weighting" anything on the front/trend/all pages based on categories, which is possibly the direction they're planning this - I think that would be disastrous.

edit: I also think the **s should work properly on making things italic or bold, they're remarkably hit and miss. @kek @arkitekt @captainmeta4

parent.body:
Sweet, I made it onto another list in life. In fact I am more than one person on that list.

That said, I don't fully agree with the premise; I have created 200+ guilds in my time here, all of them except one being apolitical, and the vast majority of them are still semi-active (1+ post/month)...including pretty much every food guild except +Donuts. 

I do everything I can to drown out the hate; I don't cooperate with RCP but I have....more usernames on here than I can possibly ever remember. When Klenny got banned (and I do hate him as well, whiny little retard) I pointed out to him that I possibly ran more guilds across my sockpuppets than he did but admins never banned me...why? Realistically probably just because I'm a "force for good" in the world, and he's a "force for whiny stormfag bullshit". Is it fair? Probably not. Do I support the distinction? Probably not. Is it worth tearing down the site? Not really.

I hate the Milkit/Stormfag/JG nonsense on the site, and I think it should be as easy as possible for users to choose to block it all with one click...but the important word there is "choose to";  **I don't think it should be opt-in or opt-out, I think when you register your account it should just ask you which you prefer. **

I also think mods should go through the "Uncategorized" guilds and put the ones that GMs have never categorized into what appears to be common-sense categories ( +Cheese is probably food, +elephants is probably animals) - and I dislike their laziness on this matter. If you're going to roll out something like categories, you need to expect lots of manual work.

I strongly disagree with "weighting" anything on the front/trend/all pages based on categories, which is possibly the direction they're planning this - I think that would be disastrous.

edit: I also think the **s should work properly on making things italic or bold, they're remarkably hit and miss. @kek @arkitekt @captainmeta4

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

body:
All categories should be selected/on by default.

The individual user then chooses which categories they consent not to see by deselecting them.

This is informed consent.

**There is no way to guarantee some users may not be aware their feed is censored if categories are deselected/off by default.**

All categories should be selected/on for all existing users. This will mitigate the above issue initially.

All new users could be advised how to deselect categories they do not want to see on signup, until it is possible to do this in the sign up process itself.

I'm not always the best at explaining what I mean. I hope this makes sense.

body:
this has quite the ratioed comments to upvotes

Hmmm, I'm not sure I'm for a total absolute freedom of speech, like, do you want porn on all or home page? I am ok with that being marked "offensive" - I might be willing to debate over other things being marked offensive though or something

There is a difference to me between there being legal freedom of speech, and of creating speech codes on things you create or use - I am fine with banning for example communist promotion or abortion promotion for example at times, I'm not going to put on an event and highlight those topics

Of course Ruqqus says it's a "free speech site without censorship" or something like that; I guess the thing is, when people talk about "free speech", this is a vague concept. By "free speech", you don't mean sharing illegal things, of course, right? Defamation, illegal pornographies, etc. - you're fine with this speech being restricted. Communism and abortion should be illegal things, or are of the character of illegalities, but are legal - so again it comes down to what does "free speech" really mean.

I think also too these is a focus on, well, I am only engaging in "free speech" if I can say something offensive and controversial. I think there's something to be said about this, but, if we don't get overly focused on it, we realize that we have tons of freedom of speech to otherwise speak on an unending variety of topics (as evidenced by the new category system). 

So, I guess another question is about, "what do you want free speech for?" Are you bothered that defamation and certain pornographies are illegal, are you on a mission to legalize them because a kind of "absolute free speech" is valuable in itself to you? Or, if you are ok with those restrictions, is it possible to think of free speech in a different way ("some exceptions may apply")?

This is kind of an open-ended comment I send, I've thought about these issues a bit and don't necessarily have the perfect answer for these problems - I have concluded that "censorship" is also an exercise of freedom though, because an absolute respect for "free speech" would also include a tolerance of illegal offensive pornographies, defamation, advocating for communism, advocating for killing children as "women's rights", etc. but it feels as an exercise of freedom to restrict the speech of those things. (Filtering pornography as offensive "frees" me from having to see it, on the home page, for instance). It may be a trade off.

parent.body:
this has quite the ratioed comments to upvotes

Hmmm, I'm not sure I'm for a total absolute freedom of speech, like, do you want porn on all or home page? I am ok with that being marked "offensive" - I might be willing to debate over other things being marked offensive though or something

There is a difference to me between there being legal freedom of speech, and of creating speech codes on things you create or use - I am fine with banning for example communist promotion or abortion promotion for example at times, I'm not going to put on an event and highlight those topics

Of course Ruqqus says it's a "free speech site without censorship" or something like that; I guess the thing is, when people talk about "free speech", this is a vague concept. By "free speech", you don't mean sharing illegal things, of course, right? Defamation, illegal pornographies, etc. - you're fine with this speech being restricted. Communism and abortion should be illegal things, or are of the character of illegalities, but are legal - so again it comes down to what does "free speech" really mean.

I think also too these is a focus on, well, I am only engaging in "free speech" if I can say something offensive and controversial. I think there's something to be said about this, but, if we don't get overly focused on it, we realize that we have tons of freedom of speech to otherwise speak on an unending variety of topics (as evidenced by the new category system). 

So, I guess another question is about, "what do you want free speech for?" Are you bothered that defamation and certain pornographies are illegal, are you on a mission to legalize them because a kind of "absolute free speech" is valuable in itself to you? Or, if you are ok with those restrictions, is it possible to think of free speech in a different way ("some exceptions may apply")?

This is kind of an open-ended comment I send, I've thought about these issues a bit and don't necessarily have the perfect answer for these problems - I have concluded that "censorship" is also an exercise of freedom though, because an absolute respect for "free speech" would also include a tolerance of illegal offensive pornographies, defamation, advocating for communism, advocating for killing children as "women's rights", etc. but it feels as an exercise of freedom to restrict the speech of those things. (Filtering pornography as offensive "frees" me from having to see it, on the home page, for instance). It may be a trade off.

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

body:
Whether or not something should be opt-in or out is a discussion worth having. However, as long as the user is made aware that opt-in is by default, I don't see the problem. Users just need to be aware that other content is out there that they can choose to see if they wish. 

Personally, I think people would have better luck giving the admins friendly suggestions on how they think the site should be run instead of taking a more confrontational approach. Perhaps you have done so. And this isn't directed at you specifically, but what I see in general is that a lot of people here are acting like spoiled children. They run around calling names, screaming accusations, and making demands like they own the place, and then act SHOCKED that the admins don't like them and don't want them in their guilds.

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

body:
I feel like an odd duck out in those tags, and I haven't yet dug through the discussion on the update post that caused this discussion, but I'll still share my two cents.

Miscategorization: Are we still limited to only one category? If so, if your guild is, say, politically incorrect memes, and you categorize it as memes instead of offensive, the given screenshot to me suggests that it will be allowed to stay in memes, even if the admins consider it offensive. I think this miscategorization thing might not be as big of a deal as it may appear to others, that is if the one-category rule still applies.

Opt-ins and opt-outs: I'm not a big fan of content being hidden by default. Ideally, I think users should be ushered towards playing with their settings, either making it part of the signup process or having a sort of reminder *somewhere* until they mess with the settings. I think I saw someone suggesting that something of the sort will be coming with Vue? I definitely see where some are coming from in saying that it should be opt-out instead of opt-in in the meantime, and its definitely questionable that we even landed on opt-in in the first place.

Kicking the post: Bad move on the admins' part. They should be open to letting it be discussed there, and if it gains traction, they should be able to hold their own on giving their side. As is, they just made it look like they want to either hide criticism, or are unable to handle it.

Philosophy of Ruqqus and Slippery Slope: Honestly, I think the slippery slope started when people began ceding on degenerate shit, such as loli. Who the fuck is going to defend that shit? But now, we've lost most of the weebs, who have just gone back to making alt-reddit guilds; the people we've already lost on the front line sure aren't going to be supporting us. Remember they mostly ended up here because "trap is offensive to trans people".

Ultimately, I have my concerns with the future of Ruqqus, but I'm skeptical that this is really a nail in that coffin. I always do appreciate seeing people raise their concerns as well, would love some commentary on the admins' part on why stuff like this is unwanted in +Ruqqus

body: I like having categories and don't find this to be a bad form of censorship. Sometimes I am in the mood for outrageous language and topics, but other times I'd prefer a more peaceful, subdued atmosphere and so don't want to see or feel others' negativity. I think of this a bit like those rooms really large nightclubs sometimes have: rooms for adults, rooms for more immature people, rooms where there might be a bit of sexual activity, rooms for lots of gays....I get to choose which room I go to and when. I don't always want to hang around immature or gay or sexual activity....sometimes I find it fun or funny in a pathetic kind of way...

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary‚Ä¶

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the ‚ÄúPhilosophy of Ruqqus.‚Äù It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

Designating all our guilds as ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let‚Äôs stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**
